comment.author: 21686909@N07
comment._content: Ha, imagine trying to catch a ball one handed with that glove, and that is one of the better gloves of that time.

comment.author: 91829349@N00
comment._content:
This one's a puzzler.  There's no one Google recognizes by the name "Chisson," and he's not listed on any of the A's rosters 1912-1918.  The script at the right side of the photo appears to say "Chrishong" or "Chiesong" or "Chrishoug" or maybe "Chris Long," but I can't find any of them either.  The only 1914 or 1915 A's players whose names end in "g" are Rube Oldring and Wally Schang, and this guy is neither of them.

Either this is mis-labeled or the guy was a flashy recruit who never actually played.
